parameters.definition: Number of customers a large cruise ship can carry
Pollution units produced by a large cruise ship trip
Number of customers a small cruise ship can carry
Pollution units produced by a small cruise ship trip
Maximum number of large cruise ship trips
Minimum percentage of total trips that must be by small cruise ships
Minimum number of customers the company aims to transport

description: A cruise company can either have two types of trips, a large cruise ship or a small cruise ship. A large cruise ship trip can carry \param{LargeShipCapacity} customers and produces \param{LargeShipPollution} units of pollution. A small cruise ship trip can carry \param{SmallShipCapacity} customers and produces \param{SmallShipPollution} units of pollution. There can be at most \param{MaxLargeShipTrips} large cruise ship trips and at least \param{MinSmallShipTripPercent} of the total trips must be made by small cruise ships. If the cruise company aims to transport at least \param{MinCustomers} customers, how many of each size of cruise ships should the company use to minimize the total amount of pollution produced?
